title: Riot, Do Something About Bots
body: Remember Riot, that's one of the reason's RuneScape lost it's popularity. Annoying ass bots.

replies.body:
I actually had this issue not too long ago when I queued for TT normals at 5:30 AM.

Ended up in a game with 5 bots. No one communicated, and no one played like a person. I could take objectives with no resistance or response and triple the opposing team with no effort because they were severely underleveled and underfarmed.

It wasn't an enjoyable experience.
Thanks for the replies, this will help us isolate and take action

Hi BuboBubo, any update on this issue?  I thought things were better, but apparently I had just had a good luck run.  The last 5 games of mine have all had bots.  I enjoy treeline for the quicker gametimes, but not having quality competition really sucks the fun out of it...

Hrm, what game mode were you playing and what tipped you off to them being a bot? We've regularly clamped down bots in the past but new ones do pop up and we are always on the lookout for emerging threats. Thanks for the feedback!
Personally, I see bots in ARAM pretty much every third game. While it has gotten better, there are still lots of them out there.
What tipped you off to it being a bot? Was it a specific champion played a certain way? strange buys?

I don't know if they're following the same pattern nowadays but back when I first started doing PVP bots were rampant in ARAM. Eventually my MMR rose to where they didn't get matched with me anymore, but in the early going sometimes it would be 4 bots on my team and 5 on the enemy team. There were some very easy ways to spot bots:

1. They always had ghost and heal. Without exception.
2. Their name was usually two random names thrown together ("Brian Molly" for example).
3. They tended to buy the same items over and over again (ruby crystals and zeals seemed to be especially popular).
4. They fired skillshots in random directions.
5. They played like minions - just running down the lane and auto-attacking anything that came into range.
6. They never communicated (I've heard of bots that send generic messages, but these never said anything).
7. They were always using a free-to-play champion.
8. They never used their poro-snax.

Whatever program controls them may have changed since then, but there was a definite pattern with all this.

They are rampant in Dominion again. So much so that last time we played there were only 4 humans in the game ... me and my friends.  The bots are very easy to spot.  They follow very scripted behaviors.  They ignore risk and usually just walk to the nearest capture point and try to capture.  If it's already cap'd they stand around for about 10 seconds and move on to the next.  They don't fight particularly well.  Usually take the default summoners.

I report every one I see ... but frankly they've ruined Dominion ... it's been unplayable for nearly a year.

it's unlikely Riot will actually ever do something about bots unless it becomes a rampant problem in Summoner's Rift

That's the thing there. "It's unlikely Riot will actually ever do something about bots..." And that's how a lot of games get ruined, because the companies never do anything to fix the problem. However, I will say that Riot and LoL are in a better position when it comes to bots, because unlike games like RuneScape or Club Penguin, it's tougher to encounter bots at higher levels because the bots struggle to make it to that playing field. Where games like RS and CP, the bots are out in the open no matter where you are as a player. It's just an awful experience for new players/smurfs/less played modes.

Not using ULTs,
Not using items, building terrible builds. Having no runes or masteries,
Getting ghost and heal, walking into turrets from the beginning of the game, interacting oddly (or not at all) with other champions, walking to every health pack spawn point and standing there regardless if there is a health pack or not or what their health is at.

Diving into a 1v5 between two enemy turrets without using a single ability, do you really want me to go on?

You can tell it's a bot because it walks up to the first minion or champion that it encounters and attacks it. Some will attack whoever is attacking it with a priority on champions. 

Plus the fact that they never communicate and feed hard.

You guys need to add a bot report for the end of games. That would make your job WAY easier.

I'm experiencing this a bunch as well in TT since I started playing again.  Typically late night Pacific.  As far as getting tipped off I see the same as others have mentioned...instalock...items...walk by you as if you're not there.   You'll also see them do a 'back' in the beginning of the game to center themselves.  Then they time their movement to hit the lanes right in center of the lanes.

I see them on low levels with some buddies that have just started playing the game (really ruins it for them), and I've also seen it at lvl 30.

about a year ago my roommate was playing a coop vs ai match and his soraka support was clearly a bot. She never left his side and did some of the stupidest things.

I literally sat there as I watched my roommate use dragon to kill his soraka, she didn't even flinch as she became dragon food.

Wow, I'm surprised you don't know yet. First of all, they don't chat and instalock. Then, they don't fight, and if they do capture they probably stand under turret and only attacks people who come near. Some which don't or haven't captured a point go around dying to turrets because they don;t care if they're getting hit by a turret or not.

How severe is it? I've had a game with me and 9 other bots; or, sometimes, me versus 2 people on the other team and all bots. The unfair thing is that 2v1 makes it impossible to play.

Twisted treeline is INFESTED with bots...i cant imagine you guys havent noticed it 

but also i have seen 1 bot on the Rift it ran straight down mid and attacked nothing(also it was a really long time ago over a year ago), i dont remember the summoners/champ/items

i havent seem any bots on ARAM

But twisted treeline is mostly bots(for at least the last year or so) they all take Ghost and Heal run down a lane auto attack the first creep/structure they see they will use abilities/summoners to escape , the seem to build the sorcerers shoes and then amplifying tome into a revolver, and i believe they tend to take ap based champions but im  not sure on that

Twisted Treeline and Dominion are literally nothing but bots.

You will be lucky to find another human player.

You can tell because they all clump together and walk to the same spot repeatedly and die. They always rush tier 2 boots (Either berserkers or Sorcs)

You see a lot of bots in lower 'summoner' level games. Especially in level 1-10 (maybe even up to 15). And trust me before you say, "they're less experienced players." You can tell a real person between a bot.

That may be vague, but you have to see it and once you do, you'll know it.

I've recently leveled up to 30 and I saw a ton of bots in Dominion games. I remember I saw two different "species" if you will, but the predominant one always ran heal barrier summoners, and ran on a predetermined path in the beginning: on the left side, they went i believe mid to bot to top, and on the right bot to mid to top. I think they bought according to the recommended items. The other one bought the same items each game regardless of character and ran a slightly different path, but I only saw like 3 of those versus full games of the other.

Oh, and the names. They were usually procedurally named with some standard first name plus "e."

It' s been a while since i made games there, but even 3v3 and mostly dominion were plagued by bots: the presumed bot got ghost heal, never fully compleated items, odd interaction without using skills, stacking on places and so on.

It might even be a really really noob player, but the coincidences were really repetitive...
Sorry, newb here, what is I bot? I know it as the started enemy and the lane. What is it in application to this?

The bots we're talking about aren't the bots from Co-op vs. AI created by Riot. We're talking about player bots, which disguise as a real player (but are god awful) but are actually robots. I think many assume these are created so people can sell level 30 smurfs without having to level up the accounts themselves.
